messages.content: Is the problem that you’re trying to increment the nonce of the user’s account by sending mina?  Do you require a signature from the end user somewhere in your flow?  Sorry Im on the go so I didn’t read your code, but I wonder if you just need the user to authorize the send.
Hello, I pass the private key of the user in my tx sign method

Hey @Youtpout, you need to sign the transaction with the payer account in order to send MINA from this account. I have tried running your tests by adding the zkDepositPrivateKey to the signature, `await txn2.sign([deployerKey, zkDepositPrivateKey]).send();` in line 157, and it passed the tests. I hope this solves your problem 🙂
Thank you so I need the key of the smartcontract
Also plz let me know where you got this code snippet from so I can fix it 🙏

● Game merkle › deposit                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
    [[],[["Unexpected_verification_key_hash"]],[["Cancelled"]],[["Cancelled"]]]
That the error when you remove `requireSignature()`?
yes, but I use account createdSigned, I need signature no ?
I create the code is not from a snippet
but not signature on the zkapp account I assume
`requireSignature()` says: require a signature on this account update
`createSigned()`: create a new account update, and call `requireSignature` on it
so, you never need `requireSignature()` in addition to createSigned
and especially not on a different account
it's work if the create signed is in the smartcontract ?
works from anywhere
you can get my code here https://github.com/youtpout/zkapp-ui/blob/e20642500f92736306a50ebf8a7da8e300a713a7/contracts/src/gamedeposit.ts

messages.content: and test in gamemerkle.test.ts
Yeah all the `zkDeposit.requireSignature()` calls seem wrong to me! would you want only the smart contract developer to call those methods?

and this code looks like a bug: https://github.com/youtpout/zkapp-ui/blob/e20642500f92736306a50ebf8a7da8e300a713a7/contracts/src/gamemerkle.test.ts#L43-L52

you probably want to set the global `verificationKey2`, but instead you create a variable in a local scope with the same name and then don't use the compiled verification keys
to set a global variable, you have to assign `verificationKey2 = ...`, without the `const` declaration
are you sure , I used object destructuring https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Operators/Destructuring_assignment#object_destructuring

embeds.title: Destructuring assignment - JavaScript | MDN
embeds.description: The destructuring assignment syntax is a JavaScript expression that makes it possible to unpack values from arrays, or properties from objects, into distinct variables.

messages.content: const { verificationKey: verificationKey2 } = await GameDeposit.compile();
yeah the syntax is strange
Trust me on this, or just try it out
Ok i don’t need this part of code for the moment
